meanings.definition: To convert (organic matter) into a fossil.
meanings.sent1: The ancient bones were fossilised over time.
meanings.sent2: The dinosaur bones fossilised in the rocky ground.
meanings.sent3: The idea of using stone tools quickly fossilised as metal tools became popular.
meanings.sent4: Her childhood memories fossilised in her mind, never to be forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The story of the lost city was fossilised in the history books.

meanings.sent1: The leaf fossilised in the mud.
meanings.sent2: The tree trunk fossilised after centuries underground.
meanings.sent3: The old traditions slowly fossilised as new customs emerged.
meanings.sent4: His love for her fossilised into a deep, unchanging bond.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization fossilised in time, leaving behind ruins.

meanings.definition: To make or become antiquated or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The technology quickly fossilised, unable to keep up with advancements.
meanings.sent2: His thinking fossilised as he refused to consider new ideas.
meanings.sent3: The fashion trend fossilised into a style that no one wanted to wear.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules fossilised the once lively atmosphere into a dull routine.
meanings.sent5: The old building's design fossilised into a relic of the past.
